ContentClassification.ProviderName: Prepared by Chi Hong An, Milliman USAData provided by Iqyu Jang (KIDI)
ContentClassification.TableReference: "3rd Mortality Tables (1988 - 1992) by Korea Insurance Development Institute"
ContentClassification.TableName: 1988-92 Korea Annuity Table, Male - PENDING VALIDATION
ContentClassification.TableDescription: TM-Country: Korea Source of data: Direct standard individual insurance ( KIDI mortality study) Volume of data: Based on 100,684 death claims (male: 74,327, female:26,357) Observation period: 1988 to 1992 policy years Unit of observation: Number of Lives Construction method: Based on policies issued after January 1, 1976. Data from 6 largest companies Excluded claim data during first policy year due to underwriting effects, high lapse rates, antiselection. Mortality Improvement: Rate = 1 - (qx(new) / qx(old)) ^ (new - old) Period = Max (x-40, 15) Graduation order 1) Jenkins 2) Greville 3) Gompertz 4) Compared with 1994 Individual Annuity Table 1) Jenkins: only apply to calculate mortality rates for age 12 to 67. 2) Greville: for fitness of data. 3) Gompertz: after age 67 4) Compared with 1994 Individual Annuity Table: = Min ( Rates from (3), Rates from 1994 Individual Annuity table) Note: Death claims don't include the first degree disability claims Minimum age: 45 Maximum age: 106 Number of decimal places: 5 Hash value: 1880138714
ContentClassification.Comments: Based on same data as 3rd life insurance mortality tables. NOTE: the contents of this table have yet to be validated against a published source to ensure no transcription errors have occurred
